job.description: This workflow is a template that demonstrates how to use pooled connections to SQL databases across multiple SQL tasks (basically when running several tasks concurrently on the same machine). The workflow is composed of a single task Open\_Pooled\_connection\_and\_Execute\_Query that executes SELECT operations. Before the execution, the user has to provide the following variables: RDBMS_NAME is the relational database management system name e.g. postgresql, mysql, greenplum, hsqldb, oracle... HOST (required) is the server host. Default value is localhost. USERNAME (required) is the username used for accessing the SQL database. PORT (required) is the listening port. DATABASE (required) is the database name. POOL_PROPERTY (optional) HikariCP offers many data source properties that can be used to configure the DB pooled connection such as autoCommit, maximumPoolSize, maxLifetime, idleTimeout .... You can add as many properties as you want. For each one, add a new task variable where the variable name is the property name having "POOL_" as a prefix (e.g. POOL_autoCommit, POOL_maximumPoolSize) and the variable value is the property value. For more info, please refer to https://github.com/brettwooldridge/HikariCP. SQL_STATEMENTS (required) is a string composed of a set of query statements (SELECT statement). OUTPUT_TYPE (optional) if set to HTML, it allows to preview the results in the Scheduler Portal in a HTML format. if set to CSV, it allows to download the results from the Scheduler Portal in a CSV format. Default value is HTML. STORE_RESULT_VARIABLE (optional) if not empty, the value will be the name of a variable that contains the resultSet (converted into a List of Maps) of the query. This variable can be used in other tasks. The java doc can be found here: <https://docs.oracle.com/javase/7/docs/api/java/sql/ResultSet.html>

task.name: Open_Pooled_Connection_and_Execute_Query
task.description: This task allows to open a pooled connection to any SQL database and then execute any SQL query statements on it. If it requires a password, you have to add it using the following third-party credential: {key: rdbms_name://<username>@<host>:<port>, value: RDBMS_PASSWORD}. Please refer to the User documentation to learn how to add third-party credentials. This task has the same list of workflow variables.
